presentations.name: How to be an awesome developer and get paid well at the same time!
presentations.description: What does it take to be an awesome developer and how do you ensure you get paid well.

presentations.name: Learn to be a DevOps - Workshop
presentations.description: A workshop that teaches the flow of continuous integration and continuous deployment.

presentations.name: Distributed file system with IPFS
presentations.description: A presentation about distributed hash tables, hashing of files and hands on use of IPFS.

presentations.name: React Workshop
presentations.description: Made a workshop on how to get started with React and the attendees made a contact formular.

presentations.name: Universal Apps - The good, the bad and the ugly
presentations.description: My experiences on developing universal apps and what to do and what not to do.

presentations.name: How to deploy with Docker
presentations.description: I showed how to deploy a website from scracth with Docker.

presentations.name: Docker Introduction - What you need to know
presentations.description: Talked about why Docker matters and the reason why it is a billion dollar company. Showed a demo on how to use Docker.

presentations.name: Swarm 1.1 release and Introduction
presentations.description: Showed the newest version of Docker, including that of rescheduling of containers.

presentations.name: Kubernetes Introduction - Workshop 3 hours
presentations.description: Made a workshop with 5 scenarios on how to use Kubernetes, from launching a Kubernetes cluster on your own computer to the hardest scenario of launching a fault-tolerant Redis cluster.

presentations.name: Introduction to HTML and CSS
presentations.description: Prepared a introduction to learn a group of girls how to think in HTML, "everything is a square" and the semantic of html tags.

presentations.name: How do you survive key-loss with Docker?
presentations.description: Gave a thorough guide on how docker hub can survive a key loss with their Docker Notary project. Talking about how they switch out root keys and their standard they have published.

presentations.name: JavaScript Jeopardy
presentations.description: Prepared a 30 multiple-choice about everything from founders of projects to how to change the inline style of a element with basic JavaScript.

presentations.name: Introduction to Docker - Workshop
presentations.description: Gave a 3-hour introduction to Docker about everything you need to know. We talked about why it mattered and how to get started with Docker on their next project.

presentations.name: The land of Isomorphic Apps
presentations.description: Talked about my experience creating a universal app. What to do and especially what not to do!

presentations.name: Face Recognition on old pictures
presentations.description: During a hackathon, I worked on doing facial recognition and then gave a presentation on what I found interesting with the results and how to get started with it.

presentations.name: Introduction to webtorrent
presentations.description: I had been hacking around with webtorrent and gave a talk about this project. I showed some small projects that I have made and explained the concept of webtorrent and what made it work.

presentations.name: Lessons learnt building with Reflux.js
presentations.description: I talked about lesson learned working with Reflux.js, a simple flux implementation. I showed why a unidirectional flow was a positive thing for both the development and debugging part of web development.

presentations.name: Docker Hosting - How to ship those containers?
presentations.description: We all love containers, but what are the actually easiest ways to get started hosting those containers online. I showed an example on how to get started with hosting containers on Tutum (now Docker Cloud).

presentations.name: Firespeed prototyping with Firebase
presentations.description: I had been working on Firebase some time and showed how it was awesome for small and quick prototypes where you wanted something awesome quick.

presentations.name: 20 minutes Super Mario
presentations.description: I showed how you could build a Super Mario clone in literally 20 minutes of time with Crafty.js and all the built in modules.
